Summary: Large dark triangle aircraft with bright underside lights, made no sound
divs: sighting detailsthis is the third time in the past 6 months that i've seen this large object\aircraft in the night skies over the metro denver area. at roughly 4:15am on 8\14\13 i was driving westbound on 6th ave. 1\2 a mile away from the exit at wadsworth (south bound exit). i spotted an aircraft(?) above the walmart near 1st and wadsworth- roughly... just guessing, helicopter flight elevation, slow moving west to east. what struck me was how this craft resembled the previous two sightings i witnessed this year. the aircraft seems to be larger than a commercial airliner, with three bright white 'led' lights on the front forward facing underside and a smaller flashing white 'led' on the wingtip. the speed it was traveling was slow, possibly 90mph. as i drove off 6th ave. onto southbound wadsworth i could see the back underside of the aircraft. like my two previous sightings the underside 'flat pattern' of the yellowish lower lights is honeycombed patterned, triangle shaped layout i guess; non flashing. from this angle, looking directly at the back of the aircraft i could now see two flashing 'led' lights on the wingtips. and again, with my window rolled down, no sound from the craft could be heard. my feelings after each time i saw this object was that of awe: this thing is awesome! i would guess that it's a new type of military aircraft, if it is, this is some insane new technology that is far more advanced than the sr-71, stealth fighters and bombers we are used to seeing. please, if anybody is awake around 3am-4:30am and you live in the jefferson county area in denver- please keep an eye on the night skies and hopefully you'll see this 'thing' too! each time i saw this craft it was flying (roughly) from the south west (morrison) foothills area towards fitzsimmons\cu medical university area (east). if mufon is interested, i am a freelance illustrator and i can do a detailed sketch of what i witnessed.
